casebody.data:
SPEARMAN v. UNITED STATES. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. November 19, 1921.) No. 3740. In Error to the District Court of the United States for the Southern District of Texas; Joseph C. Hutcheson, Jr., Judge. Criminal prosecution by the United States against G. T. Spearman. Judgment of conviction, and defendant brings error. Affirmed. V. M. Clark, of Houston, Tex. (Quitman Finlay and Tumley & Clark, all of Houston, Tex., on the brief), for plaintiff in error. D. E. Simmons, U. S. Atty., and D. A. Simmons, Ass’t U. S. Atty., both of Houston, Tex.

Before WALKER, BRYAN, and KING, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The judgment in this case is affirmed.
